data.title: Good selection of pizza's
data.text: Visited with adult family. Nice patio to sit out under the stars and enjoy a tasty pizza. Good service. Would visit again.

data.title: Closet to real Chi-town deep dish in Sac
data.text:
Great deep dish!  The expansion into multiple locations speaks for itself!  Very savory crust that makes you want to eat much more than you should.

Excellent!

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Amazingly we were really disappointed wth our meal here because so many friends had told us it was the best place to have pizza in Folsom. It wasn't. We had eaten fantastic pizza at the Pizzeria across the road previously so expected at least the same standard of food and service here as there, but unfortunately the pizza was sadly disappointing as was the service. We won't be returning.

data.title: Salads and Pizza, Oh My!
data.text: Food was yummy!  We went two nights in a row.  First was a delightful experience; second night staff were not super friendly.  I definitely recommend Chicago Fire, and their specialty salads are heavenly!  Keep up the great work, chef(s)!

data.title: They have food there.
data.text:
We stopped here for dinner before a show.  It was a Friday evening, but there was no line, we walked right in.  Upon entering, I felt the room was cluttered with tables, with little cohesiveness or spacing, and it sounded like a sports bar adjacent to a university.  We were seated in the smaller back room, which was a little quieter and more organized, due to it's size, I'm sure.  

Although they didn't appear to be overly busy, and there were plenty of employees running around, the service was quite slow, from the server's first appearance, to the baked rigatoni that one friend ordered, but didn't get until the rest of us were nearly finished eating, and by that time, we had to ask that it be wrapped "To Go", as we had tickets for a show down the street.

The menu offers some interesting choices, everything that we ordered was quite tasty, and the prices were reasonable.  We're not in a hurry to go back, but we probably won't avoid Chicago Fire, in the future.

data.title: Mediocre food and service in a noisy environement
data.text: Arriving into Folsom after 18 hours travel all we really wanted was a decent meal and a quiet drink. Unfortunately we choose Chicago Fire and none of the above was available. The high ambient noise levels were elevated by a bunch of screaming teenagers, so much so that we had to ask to be moved to a quieter part of this large restaurant. Given that the place had ample vacant tables why we were places in an area adjacent to the wayward teens is something of a mystery.  It was only after some considerable time that management finally asked their rowdy guests to quieten down but by them the tone of our visit had been set. Service was extremely friendly but not very attentive and the food, which arrived in fits and starts,  was at best mediocre. Overall, not a great experience. Chicago Fire won't be going on my list for a return visit.

data.title: Inconsistent
data.text: My husband is from Chicago so we have Chicago Fire a couple times a month,  both eat-in and take out. The  Palladio store is inconsistent,  forgetting appetizers, sides,  etc. We've gotten pizzas that were overcooked/almost most burnt, wings without dressing, topping that were supposed to be added that were not, etc. The downtown Folsom location is more consistent.

data.title: Wait Time
data.text:
We ordered two pizzas the wait time was almost an hour for pizza that wasn't anything special and then another wait for the waitress too grab our cards and take to more orders before then running the card and returning I don't want someone walking all around the dinning room before taking care of our bill.
The entire meal took 2.25 hours way to long

data.title: Great Drinks and delicious pizza
data.text:
I've only ordered salad and pizza, but they are always delicious and fresh. 
I like the courtesy of the servers and the general ambience. Very popular in both Folsom locations, so you may have to wait unless you choose to sit in the bar.

data.title: Pizza all the way!
data.text: Chicago Fire has good pizza and happy hour.  Lots of pizzas to choose from and you can order half and half if you want two types of pizza on one pie.  Great for families and families celebrating birthdays for kids.  Full bar and you can order one slice of pizza during happy hour.  Make reservations on the weekend, this place gets packed.

data.title: Pizza, cocktails & my sweetie
data.text: Chicago Fire pizza never disappoints. I love the hustle and bustle in the restaurant. Although we get take out a lot too. We love deep dish and thin crust traditional.

data.title: Second trip
data.text: Made a second visit to this location and was again not disappointed. I had a personal pan pizza which was plenty large enough for one to two people. I would recommend this location. It is a little difficult to have a conversation due to the number of people and noise at the location.

data.title: Great time, delicious pizza
data.text: Came in for dinner on  Monday.  Plenty of places to sit but we decided to sit in bar area. The pizza was delicious and very filling. Service was perfect. Would definitely go back.

data.title: Awesome Pizza and Wings!
data.text: We have dinner at Chicago Fire for most of our family birthdays.  They have the best Pizza and Wings in the area.  Highly recommended.

data.title: High Quality Food/Service
data.text: Have been going to this Restaurant since I was about 12 years old. Now, almost 12 years later, I have lived in Thailanf for 3 years and miss the food all the time. Will definitely be one of my first stops when I get back to the U.S.

data.title: Used to good, now is awful
data.text: We've been patrons of this location ever since it opened. (many years)  Starting last year, we've noticed a steady decline in the quality of the pizza.  It seems that the crust is lacking an ingredient that gives it flavor and the toppings are bland as well.  We went on Thursday night and the food was terrible.  We ordered the Chicago fire combo (no green pepper, add black olive) and it didn't taste anything like that same pizza that we've ordered at least 100 times over the last 15 years.  It had a ton of hot sauce on it so when you put it in your mouth, instead of tasting pepperoni, tomato sauce, olives, sausage, etc, it just burned your mouth.  I mentioned this to the waitress and she said they've always put habanero sauce on that pizza.  Well, that was news to me!!!  We won't go back..  Instead, we'll go to their Roseville location.  We've been there a few times recently and the food was excellent.

data.title: Late dinner
data.text: We were there for a late lunch the inside dinning area was incredibly noisy however the food was very very good. Recommended this to all.  Definitely worth it

data.title: Artichoke is the best
data.text: Never had a bad experience here. Food is wonderful as is the service! The Greek thin crust is amazing.

data.title: If you love to eat pure salt, order a pizza!
data.text: Went here because we like the location on Sutter Street. Ordered a pizza and it was so salty we could not eat it. Sent it back to the kitchen and the second was exactly the same. I'm not just talking a little salty, no, it was a salt pizza! The poor waitress agreed and felt bad for us and didn't charge us and said she would let management know. A few months later we tried it again and it was exactly the same. Plus they cut the pizza into weird, small squares, like for babies, not the traditional triangle shape. As much as I tried I cannot recommend this place for pizza. I really can't understand how people can eat the food. Maybe they want you to buy a lot of beer and soda to get it down.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: I love the Traditional pizza.  So delicious and the blue cheese house salad.  The croutons are wonderful.  I prefer the one at the Palladio.  The ceilings are high and they open the windows.  They have sparkling Italian sodas that are refillable with no charge.  They have affordable pizza by the slice at lunchtime.  A definite must go.
